name: Margin
content:
# Margin

The [`Margin`(#d3e965)](/docs/weblab/margin/) property specifies the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for `margin-top`, `margin-right`, `margin-bottom`, and `margin-left`. When one value is specified, it applies the same margin to all four sides.

short_description:
Margin
The margin property specifies the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left. When one value is specified, it applies the same margin to all four sides.
tips:
* Margins create extra space *around* an element. In contrast, padding creates extra space *inside* an element.
The default margin value is 0.
* You can specify the margin for the individual sides of an element using the CSS `margin-top`, `margin-right`, `margin-bottom`, and `margin-left` properties, respectively.
